projectPurpose: To provide a high-performance, extensible SQL query engine library for developers to build data-centric systems like databases, data lakes, and analytics platforms.
mainFeatures: Extensible query engine written in Rust
Uses Apache Arrow as its in-memory format
Columnar, vectorized, multi-threaded, streaming execution engine
Built-in support for CSV, Parquet, JSON, and Avro file formats
Supports reading from object stores (S3, Azure Blob Storage, Google Cloud Storage)

alternatives.name: DuckDB
mainFeatures: Supports various file formats (CSV, Parquet, JSON, Arrow)
Integrates with data science tools (Pandas, R)

alternatives.name: Apache Spark (Spark SQL)
mainFeatures: Unified engine for large-scale data processing
Spark SQL for querying structured data (SQL/DataFrame API)
Supports batch, interactive, streaming, and ML workloads

alternatives.name: Trino
mainFeatures: Distributed SQL query engine for big data
Query federation across diverse data sources
Designed for interactive analytics and batch ETL

alternatives.name: ClickHouse
mainFeatures: Optimized for OLAP and real-time analytics

marketPositioning: Apache DataFusion is positioned as an extensible, high-performance SQL query engine library built in Rust, primarily for developers building new data-centric systems. It differentiates itself through its Rust implementation, tight integration with Apache Arrow, and its focus on providing a customizable core engine that can be embedded or used as a foundation for databases, data lakes, and analytical applications, rather than being a standalone end-user database or a large-scale distributed processing framework like Spark or Trino.
